description: This introductory-level course is part of a two-course sequence that encourages students to
assess and shape their personal relationship to mass media. Its premise is that we are all, to
some extent, uninformed and uncritical consumers of media projects and services rather than
conscientious and socially minded users of them. In this spirit, the course provides a
comprehensive historical overview of the various print and electronic media that have shaped,
and continue to shape, our lives. By examining the issues that have influenced the development
